definition: to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: She had to make up her income as a pianist by teaching piano students.
sentences.chinese: 她这个钢琴家的收入得靠教人弹琴来添补。

sentences.english: Eventually I plan to add to her scholarship fund.
sentences.chinese: 最后，我决定为她的奖学金添补资金。

sentences.english: The family is planning to use the loft area as an extra bedroom for a lodger to raise money.
sentences.chinese: 他们打算把阁楼做成一个出租的卧室来添补家用。

sentences.english: A piece of money, they certainly should not fill up on what?
sentences.chinese: 一块钱，对她们肯定不能添补什么？

sentences.english: Perhaps I could fill in for one of your office staff during the vacation period.
sentences.chinese: 在假期我或可添补贵公司的空缺。

sentences.english: Preferentially provide a complete set of scattered spare parts.
sentences.chinese: 优惠供应成套或拆零添补备件。

sentences.english: Much as I hope I may gain weight, (yet) I am still as thin as before.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我非常希望添补体重，但我仍然像以前一样的瘦。

sentences.english: To supplement their meagre income, often he used to go fishing with his friends.
sentences.chinese: 为了添补其微薄的收入，他经常与朋友们一起去钓鱼。

definition: to deal with/to wait on/to provide for
private saved money of close family members
to buy/to acquire/to add to one's possessions
to bribe/to get (luggage) ready/to put in order/to organize things/(baseball) RBI (run batted in)
to borrow money for a short time
(coll.) to cover a shortfall by using funds intended for another purpose or by borrowing some money/(coll.) to snack
to fill a vacancy/to make up for a shortage/to supply a deficiency
